RT @onefairwage Exciting news! @RepJayapal from WA will be joining Senator @KamalaHarris & OFW President Saru Jayaraman for our virtual town hall this Tuesday at 1PM EST. Please join us to learn about what the stimulus package means for you! https://www.facebook.com/events/144558796989647/

#PPP UPDATE 3/7: @federalreserve announced today it will help clear up more space on lender balance sheets to issue #PPPloans by either making #PPP more attractive to secondary market buyers, or by buying #PPP loans from lenders directly. Details this week.

RT @GovMurphy Was joined by @SenBooker for a #COVID19 video call with @VP, Dr. Debbie Birx, @WhiteHouse officials, and fellow governors, where I secured @fema support for our partnered drive-through testing sites through the end of May. This will save lives. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EU724dBWAAABGO_.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EU724dFXsAESQDT.jpg

Reminder that if you’ve recently lost health insurance due to a layoff, you are eligible to enroll in an Affordable Care Act plan.

But we have to be clear that this isn’t enough. In the middle of this pandemic, Trump must make open enrollment available to everyone.

RT @SenatorCollins UPDATE–As of 4PM today, 1,816 Maine employers will receive $510,891,620 in Paycheck Protection Plan loans.  These forgivable loans will help keep paychecks coming for tens of thousands of Mainers who work at small businesses. Together, we will weather the storm caused by COVID-19

Massachusetts has 13,837 confirmed cases of COVID-19.
State officials requested 1700 ventilators from @FEMA.
1000 were approved a week ago.
100 arrived this past weekend.

This is absurd. The MA delegation & I told FEMA: send our hospitals their equipment. https://www.bostonglobe.com/2020/04/06/nation/fed-officials-have-sent-100-1700-ventilators-mass-requested-thats-absurd-lawmakers-say/

The federal government must require that all frontline workers get protective gear NOW. https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/04/us/detroit-bus-driver-coronavirus.html

The answer is clear: our lives.

.@TheFueling in #Tampa is purchasing meals from local restaurants for health care staff fighting the #coronavirus on the front lines. .@RichCordray’s thread is so important. Nearly 3 million students nationwide don’t have access to the internet at home. Some use phones to type papers, switching back and forth between a search engine and their essay. Others rely on public wifi.

Congress must address broadband in poor and rural communities.

The plans I put out months ago to protect our people & economy from coronavirus are still what a plan should look like today. Trump punishes those who aren’t loyal to him.

He’s blatantly hostile to any sign of accountability. 

But as IG Michael Atkinson said, “Do not allow recent events to silence your voices.”

For most renters, you cannot be evicted or charged penalties for not paying rent.

For most homeowners, you can request a forbearance on your mortgage. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EU8rVaCUwAEMTs7.jpg

I am the LORD, LORD is my name; my glory I give to no other,

Election season is underway and this pandemic is already posing unprecedented challenges to in-person voting. Congress must provide states with the resources to conduct vote-by-mail, as well as safe in-person voting.

I'm working on a bill to ensure just that.

UPDATE:Progress on the #PPP item I tweeted about on Saturday.

Today @federalreserve announced it will be creating a new facility to help lenders make #PPPloans. 

Details will be provided this week but I suspect they will be buying these loans from banks to free up more lending. https://twitter.com/marcorubio/status/1246396186162053120 QT @marcorubio Second issue is that because of requirement in @SBAgov interim final rule that lenders hold loans for 7 weeks before they can be purchased,we will need a purchase mechanism through @USTreasury or @federalreserve ASAP in order for community banks & FinTech to make #Ppploans 6/13

No one should have to make a choice between exercising their right to vote and staying safe during a public health crisis. https://twitter.com/NBCNews/status/1247288752747274241 QT @NBCNews BREAKING: Wisconsin Supreme Court blocks Gov. Evers’ executive order suspending all in-person voting for Tuesday's primary. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EU9CcG6WkAETUnd.png

It's pretty simple: We need a government that’s on the side of the people and can execute in times of crisis.

I talked to @jonfavs about what that kind of government could look like (because it's sure not what we have right now). Listen in!

https://crooked.com/podcast/more-warren-less-kushner/

We have got to do everything we can to make sure that right now, our people are safe, get the paychecks that they need, receive medical care for free, and have a roof over their heads.

All American workers must be made whole. https://twitter.com/60Minutes/status/1246939370273288192 QT @60Minutes “Can I feed my family? How can I pay bills? You wonder if this last three or four months, am I going to become homeless?”  Alysha Navarro was laid off from her restaurant job. She’s single with a one-and-half-year-old daughter. https://www.cbsnews.com/news/coronavirus-economy-united-states-unemployment-60-minutes-2020-04-05/?ftag=CNM-00-10aab7d&linkId=85883713 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EU4EvgoX0AEnlcT.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1246939210675826688/pu/vid/480x270/SG48hsox9gunfWeX.mp4?tag=10

Now thousands of Wisconsinites who haven't received their mail ballot face this choice: risk their health by going to the polls tomorrow or don’t vote. All four liberals dissent. 

The conservative majority just effectively threw out thousands of ballots. Incredible. 

Link coming soon.

RT @benwikler If you requested an absentee ballot and it hasn't arrived yet—like thousands of other Wisconsinites—then you call your clerk and ask for a ballot to be emailed to you. You then find a safe way to print it out, fill it in, and drop it off. Clerk then copies it to official paper.
